messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Noni
messages.msgSnippet: she can t say Nory yet. She calls Cindy Cinny, Gabriel Gabeel etc ... From: noni411@aol.com To: unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com Sent: Thursday, April 05,
messages.messageBody:
she can't say Nory yet. She calls Cindy Cinny, Gabriel Gabeel etc
 
----- Original Message -----
From: noni411@...
To: unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 05, 2001 2:40 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Noni

I have to ask you about your address Noni? My not quite two year old daughter
calls her cousin Nory by Noni and her name is Victoria!

Johanna


Hi Johanna!

Noni comes from Tahitian Noni Juice- or the flower/fruit Morinda Citrofolia. 
It's an ancient fruit that has been used for thousand of years to keep good
health and to treat many health problems. Used mainly in the Islands where it
grows- Tahiti, Hawaii, New Guinea, maybe the Caribbean... but now it's also
used all over the world since it's being bottled now by the company Morinda. 
I was a distributor for awhile, but I just like the word Noni and 411 is my
daughter's birthday- and also the 'symbol' for information.  Why does your
daughter call her cousin Noni?  Is it that she just can't pronounce her real
name? (How cute!)

:-) Victoria
